subject: Heel Plate Light Follow, Brake Pedal Hydraulic Adjustment
description_text:
Hi,

This week I received the Pro X Ultra pedals I ordered through your website.
After putting them together and today mounting them on my rig, I am now
testing them. This brought up 2 questions for me.

The lighting is really neat and I have set it on the 3 pedals to 'Follow',
such that it goes from black (off) to a colour as I press it. I would like
to do the same for the heel plate: use 'Follow' and have the light off by
default, to then progressively light up as I press my brake pedal.
I can't find how to change the colour(s) for the heel plate though. When I
select 'Follow', it shows just 1 colour (red) and this colour I can't
change (unlike the pedal lights).

Is this just the way it works? I saw a review on Youtube of the Pro X and
the guy has the light change from green to red. Is this perhaps no longer
possible in Simsonn Manager 2.0.9 (the version I have) or with the Pro X
Ultra pedals? The one and only option I seem to have is it being coloured
red by default and then turning off as I press the brake pedal.

Secondly, the hydraulic adjustment knob at the back of the brake pedal
doesn't seem to have any effect. From a different review I got the
impression that if I set it to 8, it should make it practically impossible
to press in the brake pedal. I can't feel a difference between 0 and 8
though. Furthermore, this knob can keep spinning in either direction it
seems. I have made sure to always go back to the setting it arrived in, but
it seems like it perhaps should not be able to go from 0 directly to 8 and
vice versa. Could you please comment on this?

Thanks,
Best regards,

Dirk

conversations.body_text: Hi Dirk Deckers,    When the heel rest is set to “Follow Mode,” its color depends on which pedal it is following — throttle, brake, or clutch. You can change the heel rest color by adjusting the color mode of the selected target pedal.  Regarding the 8-level damper adjustment, we’ve optimized the overall resistance to be lighter. This change was based on feedback from some YouTube users who reported that levels above 3 were too hard to press. As a result, all 0–8 levels are now easier to operate, and the resistance is roughly aligned with Fanatec’s 8-level damping strength.  If you require stronger resistance, we recommend switching to the yellow or blue damper elastomers.
